medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant pain and nausea following meals.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a two month history of intermittent RUQ pain and nausea following meals, which became more severe and constant this morning. The pain was in the RUQ radiating toward the right flank area and persistent. She has had nausea all day and has been unable to eat. She denies vomiting and has not had any documented fevers, but was 99.2 at her PCP's office this morning. She has been passing flatus and having normal bowel movements without diarrhea or constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of cholelithiasis, positive PPD treated with incomplete course, elevated LFTs.
